intro: Strychnos ndengensis, commonly known as the African poison bush, is a deciduous shrub native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Loganiaceae family and is characterized by its simple, opposite leaves and small, yellowish-green flowers. The plant produces woody, capsule-like fruits that contain toxic seeds, which are used in traditional medicine despite their harmful properties. Its toxic alkaloids, such as strychnine, make it a potent and dangerous plant in the botanical world.
